txt.en: 'I must fight on, if I desire to see joyous times full of song.'
''Tis easy to lose sight of hope, but you have given me some measure of it.'
You have sung songs for several disheartened soldiers and bolstered their spirits.\n\nHlóthi in Zarkul-sulûn is waiting for you to report back.
'I have no words to express my gratitude, [placeholder].'

'If we are to win this war, our soldiers being in low spirits won't do! Are you up to the task of singing to them, [placeholder]?\n\n'You must have heard many songs during your travels. Perhaps you could bolster our soldiers' spirits with a few. Go forth and bring some light to our disheartened soldiers in the trenches.'
'The war may be far from over, but your singing has allowed our soldiers to forget their sorrows, if only for a little while. Thank you.'

'If we are to win this war, our soldiers being in low spirits won't do! Are you up to the task of singing to them, [placeholder]?\n\n'I'm sure you know the right songs to sing to our people and bolster their spirits. Go forth and bring some light to our disheartened soldiers in the trenches.'
War affects not just the body, but also the mind. The horrors of the War of Three Peaks have caused some Gabil'akkâ soldiers to lose hope.
The dwarf-trenches have been dug along the main road towards Gundabad.\n\nHlóthi has asked that you sing to disheartened soldiers in the trenches, so that you may bolster their spirits.
